attributes.action: All MPs and Assembly Members to take a 30% pay cut during any lockdown.
attributes.additional_details: To be more understanding to people being laid off during these troubled times and be more charitable to them.
attributes.background: All MPs and Assembly members to take a 30% pay cut and donate to charity in their constituency until the last lockdown lifted

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for setting MPs' pay. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: https://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/

Salaries for members of the Northern Ireland Assembly are set by legislation passed by that Assembly, not the UK Government or House of Commons.
